Articles.Content:
I have been playing fine with the .25 update I have been crashing now in the VAB or SPH here is the log

https://www.dropbox.com/s/zjhmvkafegwrn5a/output_log.txt?dl=0

Hopefully this can get worked out

earlier crashes that werent BSODs had this

Faulting module path: C:\Windows\SysWOW64\ntdll.dll

Edited October 10, 2014 by Nesterus

For the BSODs would it be possible for you to upload the BSOD crash logs... I think they have some I havn't had a BSOD in a while XD. It is very likely you are running out of memory, or KSP is using all the memory plus some of windows' memory which windows doesn't like so it BSODs. I haven't actually read you KSP log yet tho, I will get to that later because I am on my mobile.

Cheers,

ToTheMun

In 97% of all cases a BSOD is caused by faulty drivers. The rest is caused by faulty hardware.

I most cases the gpu driver are buggy. Try another version and tell us if it helped.

Windows will not BSOD because of low memory. It will simply enlarge the pagefile to provide more (virtual) memory if allowed. If it isn't allowed it will reject user programs to allocate (more) memory and thus letting them crash.

I am using a GeForce GTX 770 updated to current.

[h=3][/h]
